com.jme3.scene.plugins.blender.animations

Class BoneContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jme3.scene.plugins.blender.animations.BoneContext

  • public class BoneContext
extends java.lang.Object
    This class holds the basic data that describes a bone.

    • Field Detail

      • CONNECTED_TO_PARENT

        public static final int CONNECTED_TO_PARENT
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • BONE_ARMATURE_TRANSFORMATION_MATRIX

        public static final Matrix4f BONE_ARMATURE_TRANSFORMATION_MATRIX
        The bones' matrices have, unlike objects', the coordinate system identical to JME's (Y axis is UP, X to the right and Z toward us). So in order to have them loaded properly we need to transform their armature matrix (which blender sees as rotated) to make sure we get identical results.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BoneContext

        public BoneContext(java.lang.Long armatureObjectOMA,
           Structure boneStructure,
           BlenderContext blenderContext)
            throws BlenderFileException
        Constructor. Creates the basic set of bone's data.
        Parameters:
        armatureObjectOMA - the OMA of the bone's armature object
        boneStructure - the bone's structure
        blenderContext - the blender context
        Throws:
        BlenderFileException - an exception is thrown when problem with blender data reading occurs

    • Method Detail

      • buildBone

        public Bone buildBone(java.util.List<Bone> bones,
             java.lang.Long skeletonOwnerOma,
             BlenderContext blenderContext)
        This method builds the bone. It recursively builds the bone's children.
        Parameters:
        bones - a list of bones where the newly created bone will be added
        skeletonOwnerOma - the spatial of the object that will own the skeleton
        blenderContext - the blender context
        Returns:
        newly created bone

      • getBone

        public Bone getBone()
        Returns:
        built bone (available after calling 'buildBone' method)

      • getBoneOma

        public java.lang.Long getBoneOma()
        Returns:
        the old memory address of the bone

      • getLength

        public float getLength()
        The method returns the length of the bone. If you want to use it for bone debugger take model space scale into account and do something like this: boneContext.getLength() * boneContext.getBone().getModelSpaceScale().y. Otherwise the bones might not look as they should in the bone debugger.
        Returns:
        the length of the bone

      • getArmatureObjectOMA

        public java.lang.Long getArmatureObjectOMA()
        Returns:
        OMA of the bone's armature object

      • getSkeletonOwnerOma

        public java.lang.Long getSkeletonOwnerOma()
        Returns:
        the OMA of the model that owns the bone's skeleton

      • getSkeleton

        public Skeleton getSkeleton()
        Returns:
        the skeleton the bone of this context belongs to

      • getBoneMatrixInModelSpace

        public Matrix4f getBoneMatrixInModelSpace()
        Returns:
        the initial bone's matrix in model space

      • is

        public boolean is(int flagMask)
        Tells if the bone is of specified property defined by its flag.
        Parameters:
        flagMask - the mask of the flag (constants defined in this class)
        Returns:
        true if the bone IS of specified proeprty and false otherwise
